data.question: A relational database consists of a collection of
data.explanation: Fields are the column of the relation or tables. Records are each row in a relation. Keys are the constraints in a relation.

data.question: A ________ in a table represents a relationship among a set of values.
data.explanation: Column has only one set of values. Keys are constraints and row is one whole set of attributes. Entry is just a piece of data.

data.question: The term _______ is used to refer to a row.
data.explanation: Tuple is one entry of the relation with several attributes which are fields.

data.question: The term attribute refers to a ___________ of a table.
data.explanation: Attribute is a specific domain in the relation which has entries of all tuples.

data.question: For each attribute of a relation, there is a set of permitted values, called the ________ of that attribute.
data.explanation: The values of the attribute should be present in the domain. Domain is a set of values permitted.

data.question: Database __________ which is the logical design of the database, and the database _______ which is a snapshot of the data in the database at a given instant in time.
data.explanation: Instance is an instance of time and schema is a representation.

data.question: Course(course_id,sec_id,semester)
data.explanation: The relation course has a set of attributes course_id,sec_id,semester .

data.question: Department (dept name, building, budget) and Employee (employee_id, name, dept name, salary)
data.explanation: Here the relations are connected by the common attributes.

data.question: A domain is atomic if elements of the domain are considered to be ____________ units.
The tuples of the relations can be of ________ order.
data.explanation: The values only count. The order of the tuples does not matter.
